what: Add Centroid to Movement Data — add_centroid
title: Add Centroid to Movement Data — add_centroid
text: Calculates adds centroid point movement tracking data. centroid represents mean position selected keypoints time point individual (trial/session present).

title: Add Centroid to Movement Data — add_centroid
code: add_centroid(   data,   include_keypoints = NULL,   exclude_keypoints = NULL,   centroid_name = "centroid" )

title: Add Centroid to Movement Data — add_centroid
text: data aniframe object containing movement tracking data. Must Cartesian coordinates (x, y, /z columns). include_keypoints Optional character vector specifying keypoints use centroid calculation. NULL (default), keypoints used unless exclude_keypoints specified. used simultaneously exclude_keypoints. exclude_keypoints Optional character vector specifying keypoints exclude centroid calculation. NULL (default), keypoints excluded unless include_keypoints specified. used simultaneously include_keypoints. centroid_name Character string specifying name centroid keypoint. Default "centroid".

title: Add Centroid to Movement Data — add_centroid
text: aniframe object structure input, additional keypoint level representing centroid. centroid calculated combination grouping variables (individual, time, trial/session present). Coordinate values (x, y, z) mean selected keypoints, confidence value set NA. coordinate dimension present input data, NA centroid. values coordinate NA given time point, centroid coordinate also NA.

title: Add Centroid to Movement Data — add_centroid
text: function calculates centroid mean position selected keypoints time point, respecting grouping variables aniframe (individual, trial, session, etc.). function handles: Missing coordinate dimensions (x, y, z) - calculates means present dimensions NA values - uses na.rm = TRUE calculating means -NA cases - returns NA coordinate 1D, 2D, 3D data automatically Keypoints can selected either specifying ones include (include_keypoints) ones exclude (exclude_keypoints), . resulting centroid added new keypoint level data.

title: Add Centroid to Movement Data — add_centroid
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Add centroid using all keypoints data_with_centroid <- add_centroid(movement_data)  # Calculate centroid using only specific keypoints data_with_centroid <- add_centroid(   movement_data,   include_keypoints = c("head", "thorax", "abdomen") )  # Calculate centroid excluding certain keypoints data_with_centroid <- add_centroid(   movement_data,   exclude_keypoints = c("antenna_left", "antenna_right"),   centroid_name = "body_centroid" ) } # }

title: aniframe package — aniframe
text: R package providing core data structures movement data. Creates specialized data frame animal tracking data required columns positional data (x/y/z) time, plus optional columns individual, keypoint, trial, session identifiers.

title: aniframe package — aniframe
aniframe package — aniframe
text: ... Name-value pairs create columns data frame metadata Optional list metadata .rows Number rows (passed tibble) .name_repair repair column names (passed tibble)

Default metadata structure — default_metadata
text: Returns list containing default metadata fields initial values aniframe object. fields initialized NA set appropriately data.

title: Default metadata structure — default_metadata
Default metadata structure — default_metadata
text: named list following fields: source: Data source identifier (character, NA) source_version: Version data source (character, NA) filename: Original filename (character, NA) sampling_rate: Sampling rate Hz (numeric, NA) start_datetime: Start date time recording (POSIXct, NA) reference_frame: Reference frame (factor, "allocentric") coordinate_system: Coordinate system (factor, "cartesian") point_of_reference: Point reference (factor, "bottom_left")

title: Create example aniframe data — example_aniframe
text: Generates synthetic aniframe object random coordinates testing demonstration purposes. function creates complete design combinations time points, individuals, keypoints, trials, sessions.

title: Create example aniframe data — example_aniframe
code: example_aniframe(   n_obs = 50,   n_individuals = 3,   n_keypoints = 11,   n_trials = 1,   n_sessions = 1,   n_dims = 2 )

title: Create example aniframe data — example_aniframe
text: n_obs Integer. Number time observations per combination. Default 50. n_individuals Integer. Number individuals simulate. Default 3. n_keypoints Integer. Number keypoints per individual (max 11). Default 11. set 1, "centroid" used. Otherwise, anatomical keypoints used (head, neck, shoulders, etc.). n_trials Integer. Number trials per session. Default 1. n_sessions Integer. Number sessions. Default 1. n_dims Integer. Number spatial dimensions (1, 2, 3). Default 2. 1, x coordinates generated. 2, x y coordinates generated. 3, x, y, z coordinates generated.

title: Create example aniframe data — example_aniframe
text: aniframe object containing randomly generated tracking data columns individual, keypoint, time, trial, session, spatial coordinates (x, y, /z depending n_dims). coordinates drawn standard normal distribution.

title: Create example aniframe data — example_aniframe
code: # Create a basic example with default parameters (2D) example_aniframe() #> # Individuals: 1, 2, 3 #> # Keypoints:   head, neck, shoulder_right, shoulder_left, abdomen, hip_right, #> #   hip_left, knee_right, knee_left, foot_right, foot_left #> # ℹ 1,640 more rows  # Create a 1D example example_aniframe(n_dims = 1) #> # Individuals: 1, 2, 3 #> # Keypoints:   head, neck, shoulder_right, shoulder_left, abdomen, hip_right, #> #   hip_left, knee_right, knee_left, foot_right, foot_left #> # Sessions:    1 #> # Trials:      1 #>    session trial individual keypoint  time        x confidence #>      <int> <int> <fct>      <fct>    <int>    <dbl>      <dbl> #>  1       1     1 1          head         1 -1.38         0.842 #>  2       1     1 1          head         2  0.0854       0.932 #>  3       1     1 1          head         3  0.00483      0.714 #>  4       1     1 1          head         4  0.875        0.735 #>  5       1     1 1          head         5  2.53         0.890 #>  6       1     1 1          head         6  0.672        0.921 #>  7       1     1 1          head         7 -0.378        0.843 #>  8       1     1 1          head         8  0.820        0.689 #>  9       1     1 1          head         9 -1.23         0.706 #> 10       1     1 1          head        10  0.853        0.696 #> # Sessions:    1 #> # Trials:      1 #>    session trial individual keypoint  time      x       y confidence #>      <int> <int> <fct>      <fct>    <int>  <dbl>   <dbl>      <dbl> #>  1       1     1 1          head         1  0.962 -1.49        0.578 #>  2       1     1 1          head         2  0.337 -1.05        0.610 #>  3       1     1 1          head         3 -1.18  -0.0417      0.442 #>  4       1     1 1          head         4 -0.734  0.0916      0.789 #>  5       1     1 1          head         5 -0.363 -1.16        0.701 #>  6       1     1 1          head         6 -0.462  0.231       0.794 #>  7       1     1 1          head         7 -1.40   1.08        0.919 #>  8       1     1 1          head         8  1.18  -0.288       0.739 #>  9       1     1 1          head         9  0.699  0.739       0.802 #> 10       1     1 1          head        10  0.104  0.515       0.673 #> # Calculate trackball calibration factor — get_trackball_calibration_factor
text: Computes calibration factor converting optical flow sensor units real-world distance units. function compares known physical distance traveled trackball (based diameter number rotations) measured distance sensor units.

title: Calculate trackball calibration factor — get_trackball_calibration_factor
Calculate trackball calibration factor — get_trackball_calibration_factor
text: data aniframe object containing x y coordinates optical flow sensor. ball_diameter Numeric. diameter trackball real-world units (e.g., mm cm). ball_rotations Numeric. number complete rotations ball rotated calibration.

title: Calculate trackball calibration factor — get_trackball_calibration_factor
text: numeric calibration factor (real distance / measured distance). Multiply sensor readings factor convert real-world units.

title: Calculate trackball calibration factor — get_trackball_calibration_factor
text: returned calibration factor can used set_unit_space. function: Calculates real distance traveled circumference × rotations Measures distance sensor units using axis maximum travel Returns ratio real distance measured distance

title: Calculate trackball calibration factor — get_trackball_calibration_factor
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Calibrate with a 50mm diameter ball rotated 10 times cal_factor <- get_trackball_calibration_factor(   data = sensor_data,   ball_diameter = 50,   ball_rotations = 10 ) } # }

what: Set metadata for an aniframe — set_metadata
title: Set metadata for an aniframe — set_metadata
text: Sets updates metadata aniframe object. Metadata can provided either named arguments list. aniframe already metadata, new values merged existing values, new values taking precedence. Default metadata fields include: source: Data source identifier source_version: Version data source filename: Original filename sampling_rate: Sampling rate Hz start_datetime: Start date time recording reference_frame: Reference frame (default: "allocentric") coordinate_system: Coordinate system (default: "cartesian") point_of_reference: Point reference (default: "bottom_left")

title: Set metadata for an aniframe — set_metadata
Set metadata for an aniframe — set_metadata
text: data aniframe object ... Named metadata values (e.g., sampling_rate = 30, source = "sleap") metadata Alternatively, named list metadata. used simultaneously ...

title: Set metadata for an aniframe — set_metadata
Set metadata for an aniframe — set_metadata
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Set metadata using named arguments data <- set_metadata(data, sampling_rate = 30, source = "sleap")  # Set metadata using a list md <- list(sampling_rate = 30, source = "sleap") data <- set_metadata(data, metadata = md) } # }

what: Set the sampling rate of an aniframe object — set_sampling_rate
title: Set the sampling rate of an aniframe object — set_sampling_rate
text: Sets sampling rate (Hz) aniframe object optionally converts time values frames seconds. data already SI time units, metadata updated without modifying time values.

title: Set the sampling rate of an aniframe object — set_sampling_rate
Set the sampling rate of an aniframe object — set_sampling_rate
text: data aniframe object containing time data. sampling_rate Numeric value specifying sampling rate Hz (samples per second). example, sampling rate 30 means 30 frames per second.

title: Set the sampling rate of an aniframe object — set_sampling_rate
text: aniframe object updated sampling_rate metadata , applicable, time values converted frames seconds.

title: Set the sampling rate of an aniframe object — set_sampling_rate
text: function performs following operations: Checks current unit_time object's metadata unit_time "frame" "unknown", converts time values seconds using formula: time_in_seconds = time_in_frames / sampling_rate unit_time already SI unit (ms, s, m, h), leaves time values unchanged issues informational message Updates sampling_rate object's metadata regardless current unit_time function particularly useful working motion capture video data time initially recorded frame numbers.

title: Set the sampling rate of an aniframe object — set_sampling_rate
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Set sampling rate for data in frames (converts to seconds) data_with_rate <- set_sampling_rate(data, sampling_rate = 30)  # Set sampling rate for data already in SI units (updates metadata only) data_with_rate <- set_sampling_rate(data, sampling_rate = 100) } # }

what: Set the spatial unit of an aniframe object — set_unit_space
title: Set the spatial unit of an aniframe object — set_unit_space
text: Converts spatial coordinates (x, y, z) aniframe object different unit measurement. function handles automatic unit conversion standard units custom calibration pixel arbitrary units.

title: Set the spatial unit of an aniframe object — set_unit_space
Set the spatial unit of an aniframe object — set_unit_space
text: data aniframe object containing spatial coordinate data. to_unit Character string specifying target spatial unit. Must one permitted units defined default_metadata()$unit_space. calibration_factor Numeric value scaling spatial coordinates. Default 1. converting standard units (mm, cm, m), ignored appropriate conversion factor calculated automatically. converting "px" "unknown", must provide calibration factor define relationship current units target unit.

title: Set the spatial unit of an aniframe object — set_unit_space
text: aniframe object spatial coordinates converted specified unit updated metadata reflecting new unit_space.

title: Set the spatial unit of an aniframe object — set_unit_space
text: function performs following operations: Validates to_unit permitted spatial unit Determines current spatial unit object's metadata converting standard units (mm, cm, m) another standard unit, automatically calculates conversion factor converting "px" "unknown" units calibration_factor = 1, issues informational message returns data unchanged Applies calibration factor spatial columns (x, y, z) exist data Updates object's unit_space metadata

title: Set the spatial unit of an aniframe object — set_unit_space
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Convert from millimeters to centimeters (automatic conversion) data_cm <- set_unit_space(data, to_unit = "cm")  # Convert from pixels to millimeters with custom calibration # (e.g., 1 pixel = 0.5 mm) data_mm <- set_unit_space(data, to_unit = "mm", calibration_factor = 0.5) } # }

what: Set the temporal unit of an aniframe object — set_unit_time
title: Set the temporal unit of an aniframe object — set_unit_time
text: Converts time values aniframe object different unit measurement. function handles automatic unit conversion standard time units custom calibration frame arbitrary units.

title: Set the temporal unit of an aniframe object — set_unit_time
Set the temporal unit of an aniframe object — set_unit_time
text: data aniframe object containing time data. to_unit Character string specifying target time unit. Must one permitted units defined default_metadata()$unit_time (typically "ms", "s", "m", "h" milliseconds, seconds, minutes, hours). calibration_factor Numeric value scaling time values. Default 1. converting standard time units (ms, s, m, h), ignored appropriate conversion factor calculated automatically. converting "frame" "unknown" units, must provide calibration factor define relationship current units target unit.

title: Set the temporal unit of an aniframe object — set_unit_time
text: aniframe object time values converted specified unit updated metadata reflecting new unit_time.

title: Set the temporal unit of an aniframe object — set_unit_time
text: function performs following operations: Validates to_unit permitted time unit Determines current time unit object's metadata converting standard time units (ms, s, m, h) another standard unit, automatically calculates conversion factor converting "frame" "unknown" units calibration_factor = 1, issues informational message returns data unchanged Applies calibration factor time column Updates object's unit_time metadata

title: Set the temporal unit of an aniframe object — set_unit_time
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Convert from milliseconds to seconds (automatic conversion) data_s <- set_unit_time(data, to_unit = "s")  # Convert from frames to seconds with custom calibration # (e.g., 30 frames per second means 1 frame = 1/30 seconds) data_s <- set_unit_time(data, to_unit = "s", calibration_factor = 1/30)  # Convert from hours to minutes (automatic conversion) data_m <- set_unit_time(data, to_unit = "m") } # }

what: Transform coordinates to egocentric reference frame — transform_to_egocentric
title: Transform coordinates to egocentric reference frame — transform_to_egocentric
text: Transforms Cartesian coordinates egocentric reference frame two-step process: translation followed rotation. First translates coordinates relative reference keypoint, rotates coordinate system based specified alignment points.

title: Transform coordinates to egocentric reference frame — transform_to_egocentric
code: transform_to_egocentric(   data,   to_keypoint,   alignment_points,   align_perpendicular = FALSE )

title: Transform coordinates to egocentric reference frame — transform_to_egocentric
text: data movement data frame columns: time, individual, keypoint, x, y to_keypoint character; keypoint use new origin alignment_points character vector length 2 specifying keypoint names use alignment align_perpendicular logical; TRUE, alignment_points rotated perpendicular 0-degree axis. FALSE (default), alignment_points rotated align 0-degree axis

title: Transform coordinates to egocentric reference frame — transform_to_egocentric
text: movement data frame egocentric reference frame

title: Transform coordinates to egocentric reference frame — transform_to_egocentric
text: function combines translation rotation create egocentric reference frame. : Translates coordinates relative specified keypoint (to_keypoint) Rotates coordinate system based alignment points translation makes reference keypoint new origin (0,0), rotation standardizes orientation. particularly useful : Creating egocentric reference frames Standardizing pose data across frames individuals Analyzing relative motion patterns

title: Transform coordinates to egocentric reference frame — transform_to_egocentric
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Transform coordinates to make nose the origin and align body axis transformed_data <- transform_to_egocentric(   data,   to_keypoint = "nose",   alignment_points = c("nose", "tail"),   align_perpendicular = FALSE )  # Transform to make nose origin and ears perpendicular to forward axis transformed_data <- transform_to_egocentric(   data,   to_keypoint = "nose",   alignment_points = c("ear_left", "ear_right"),   align_perpendicular = TRUE ) } # }

title: Translate coordinates (Cartesian) — translate_coords
text: Translates coordinates Cartesian space. Takes either single point (to_x to_y), vector length time dimension keypoint (to_keypoint), can used transform data egocentric reference frame.

title: Translate coordinates (Cartesian) — translate_coords
code: translate_coords(data, to_x = 0, to_y = 0, to_z = NULL, to_keypoint = NULL)

title: Translate coordinates (Cartesian) — translate_coords
text: data movement data frame columns: time, individual, keypoint, x, y to_x x coordinates; either single value time-length vector to_y y coordinates; either single value time-length vector to_z z coordinates (3D); either single value time-length vector to_keypoint coordinates becomes relative keypoint
